body.p: Why shouldn't nursing mothers take birth control pills containing progesterone before the lactation cycle is well established?

explanation.p: While pregnant, the mother's body produces high levels of both prolactin and progesterone. The progesterone inhibits milk production until it is needed, after delivery, when progesterone levels drop. Birth control pills that contain progesterone raise the progesterone levels throughout the body. This increase may have a dramatic effect on the nursing mother's ability to produce milk. For most women, this concern lessens after the lactation cycle is well established.
